item.title: About
item.description: About me: I am an aspiring developer from Bangalore. Academics: I have pursued CBSE till grade 7, where I moved to Bengaluru(and ICSE), and finished my 10th and 12th Through NIOS I am currently pursuing BCA from from a nearby college called Gopalan College of Commerce I am also attempting to get into IIT-M’s online BS Electronics Systems course Maintaining: A Xonotic Server and A Minecraft Server(Chat bridged to discord) Personal HestiaCP server social.

item.title: App Development
item.description: UPI Viewer: A simple frontend for a UPI Powered Point of Sale System - Without using any external services or APIs! Written in Kotlin, it makes phones as old as Android 4.2 into a fully functional minimal Point of Sale machine with features like “Dynamic QR Generator”, " Split the Bill" mode, etc. Project Link Website This is ZeusInstitute OSS’s first big project. I want to try to get it on F-Droid after alpha and try to get it on Play Store after stable release.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Feel free to contact me on discord, telegram, mastodon, etc. My username is: @sounddrill My email is souhrud@live.com

item.title: Content Writing
item.description: OpenDroid Wiki: Building android is very complex, needing a lot of expertise, calmness of mind, and a non-insignificant understanding of how these devices function. I contributed to early documentation(especially helping with Crave.io related documentation) and maintain a good chunk of this at the time of writing. Website My Content Contributions Content Source for Documentation

item.title: Floorp OBS Workflow
item.description: OpenSUSE’s repos didn’t seem to have floorp browser so I made a repo that checks github releases regularly and repackages them for OBS. It’s very rough around the edges but it works great even tho I haven’t touched it in months. Repository Source Code

item.title: Github Action Projects
item.description: I have made a few useful github actions workflows to make my life easier and to help people: Crave AOSP Builder: Build Full Android ROMs - With Github Actions(Powered by Crave.io) Android is usually very big - 250 to 450GB worth of source code, needs 64GB of memory for seamless compilation, etc. While not everyone has those resources, Crave.io provides build systems to improve this, allowing anyone to learn android building.

item.title: Hobbyist Electronics
item.description: Checkpost Arduino: A simple arduino checkpost project, for a friend. Original code is from @SimpleCircuits, where I reposted and relicensed with permission. I fixed up the code and helped out with setting it up Source Code

item.title: Projects
item.description: I have created, contributed to and participated in many small projects. Here are some projects I’m proud of: {{ range where .Site.Pages “Type” “post” }} {{ if in .Params.categories “projects” }} * [{{ .Title }}]({{ .Permalink }}) {{ end }} {{ end }}

item.title: Super Mario 64 - ps2 (Fork)
item.description: This project aims to port Super Mario 64 to the PlayStation 2, after it was decompiled. For a while, it refused to work on recent sdk versions on real hardware, despite improving performance. Made a few tweaks as suggested by @metchebe and @xdccrlz here and maintained it for a while. Also made a helper script to package it into an iso for easy OpenPS2Loader use! The upstream repo seems to have fixed this issue, but when I tried it, my save got wiped :(

item.title: Web Dos Experiments
item.description: Turbo C++ is quite widely used in the academic side in India, for some weird reason. I used JS-DOS’s Bundle Creation tool and packaged @AvinashReddy3108’s TurboCPP4Linux with it to make a simple web wrapper for it This is only a proof of concept and it’s not very usable because quotes don’t work on firefox/edge Demo Source Code Also made a similar one for Norton Editor Web: Demo Source Code Also made a similar one for Costa GUI Web:
